title: OCE Boards - Thoughts and Opinions?
body:
Disscus. Do you think that having OCE boards is a good idea? A bad idea? An idea?

Also, will these board mean that OCE GD will be *sob* deleted?

replies.body:
Hey man,

Hope you guys enjoy the boards!

With regards to the old forums and GD they will be changed to read only mode. But won't be deleted so you can still go back and revisit the cool content and conversations.
I'm sure myself and many others will greatly enjoy the boards, so thank you very much to Riot for opening them! :)
well if you go and actually read what the regular forum goers are saying you will be sorely mistaken. we do not want boards, we did not ever once ask for boards, so why force us into using boards?

What is it that makes you personally so against boards?

Objectively it has more features and functionality.

You can embed pictures and gifs way easier too (just by pasting the link)! (personally one of my favorite additions)

http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/zgtu.gif
But why couldn't you just add those features into the already existing forums instead of forcing us to use boards?

There was a Q&A done a while ago which you can find [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/ITeMWouf-boards-qa-recap)

But I think the most relevant to your question HeartVine is the below excerpt:

**Zastie** wanted to know why make a new GD instead of “fixing” the classic forums. Continuing, they said: “Why does it seem like you people at Riot are against the forums SO heavily? I can understand a personal opinion, but it's gotten so far past that.

What was the point of making a GD section here, instead of just fixing up the real GD?"

**Pendragon** offered a lengthy response: “We want to build a better forum experience for players, because you deserve it. When we launched League of Legends we picked up some off-the-shelf forum software because we had no idea how big the forums and LoL were going to get. I think it was certainly the right choice at the time but over the long run there have been some pretty significant limitations that stem from that choice.

* It’s difficult to integrate into the rest of the League of Legends experience. Remember how long we had those question mark icons? We've been plagued with account authentication issues, etc.

* It’s extremely challenging to technically scale. It wasn't built to handle tens of thousands of concurrent readers and tens of thousands of daily posts. Forums going down whenever NA has stability issues, etc.

* It’s extremely challenging to extend. Doing seemingly easy things like adding search that “every other forum has” would involve months of hacky engineering work and is still not incredibly reliable. The time-cost of any given feature that we’re building on this technology is a fraction of what the same work would have been on the classic forums.

* It wasn't built to handle moderation at scale. The toolset that allows large teams of 24x7 moderators to effectively collaborate just really didn't exist in the software. And it shouldn't have because we were using it in a way that it wasn't intended to be used.

Building our own Boards platform - while a significant effort – goes a long way towards making the future better. It allows us to build forward-looking features and functionality, and lets us experiment to find the best types of community experiences.

Some dedicated members of the GD community aren't fans of nested comments or “hot” sorting, and we've heard you loud and clear - that’s why we've built a traditional “GD” style experience on the foundation of the Boards experience. While there will be a transition and things might look a little different, this unlocks our ability to improve GD and the rest of the community ecosystem.”
Ignore him. He doesn't hate boards, he just loves jumping on the bandwagon and doesn't even know why he hates it.
vbulletin that was used for old forums aren't easy to customise/add features to, and there are probably some security concerns with using a 3rd party software.

I don't know if everyone thinks the same of it is personal preference or more widespread though...
Not as mobile friendly is my only thought so far.
I think it works really well for OCE. We are a much smaller community and to streamline the boards actually makes a lot of sense to me.

I don't like how they don't go in pages and we have to click show more. It's like clicking through a picture on FB and click show more to see the comments you really wanna see besides those people tagging their friends. It's also way too dark as well. The text is way too dark to read through and it feels like you'd rather sleep rather than reading through those posts.

A few people have commented on the colouring, and I might be tempted to agree. What does this run on, PHP? Would it be a possibility to add themes? I get that the colours are supposed to be similar to the new Summoner's Rift, but maybe have a different theme for each map?

As a content creator I LOVE the change to boards. Especially the ability to post on the NA boards. I guess I'm gonna have to test them out when I finish my next animation :P
I think they look pretty nice.

A few issues I have with boards.

1. **The colouring**, it's just not pleasing to my eyes and it's harder to read just about anything, but I guess this is kinda subjective.

2. **The sorting** .
Upvote sorting by default is never a good idea to manage forum discussions because early birds can pretty much direct where a topic leads to. Not to mention since there is no pages anymore the comment sections just goes on forever, you can imagine the later posted comments or the less upvoted comments. I believe the chronological sorting being the default is the best way to go.

3. Tied with number 2, **The comment box**, why is it right after OP instead of at the bottom of the page though? 
I get it's a "comment" box so naturally it should be placed under OP but what if you read through the comments and have to scroll all the way up just to post and forward the discussion. It's not like board being the same as the old GD where each page only contains like 10 posts so scrolling isn't that much of a pain, board kinda just have an infinite list of comments, I don't think any type of actual discussion can be had here tbh. Or does Riot just want forumers engage in one liner discussion of "hey I agree" or "hey I don't agree"?

These points above imo need to be addressed.

For a possible fix to the comment box though, idk prob a "comment" button at the bottom of OP that swipes out a comment box when clicked for quick responses, then for those who are engaged in discussions, the comment section should have pages like the old GD (but OP stands out on its own, only comments are sorted in pages), with comment box at the bottom of each page.

And yes, please use time based management instead of upvote based (default), the upvote sort on the side is cool.




**EDIT**: Also because the complete lack of pages and all, the refreshing or even just loading takes ages every single time, please Riot, add pages to the comment sections.

Easier to read, easier to load, win win.
